description.narrative: The greenfield Project consists in the second rural electrification concession in Senegal awarded pursuant to an international bidding process (the Project). It will be one of IFC few forays in rural electrification, a priority of the WBG and of IFC. The Project will be developed by Compagnie Marocco-Sénégalaise dElectricité/ Louga SAU (Comasel Louga S.A.) (the Company), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Office National de lElectricité (ONE), Moroccos electricity utility. ONE has requested IFCs support for the project in the form of an equity investment for up to 19.99% of the Companys equity.

The project will have significant development impact as it will support the improvement of the living conditions of population in rural areas and the reduction of poverty. The project aims to support the progressive transformation and improvement of living conditions of the population in rural areas of Senegal which at present lacks electricity. This will be achieved by (i) providing lighting and access to modern communication to 11,826 new rural households, (ii) improving delivery of social services, health centers and schools and (iii) enhancing economic productivity through the provision of electricity for productive purposes.
The population in rural areas depends on fuel-wood for cooking, on wicks, kerosene lamps and some small batteries for lighting, and on human force frequently from women for domestic and productive tasks. The project should promote growth and the personal development of women and children by making their domestic work load less heavy
The social benefits from electrification the ability to power lights, radios, small appliances and televisions will make a significant contribution to enhancing the quality of life and the reduction of poverty.
The Project will improve access to electricity as it will provide electricity to 11,826 rural users (9,945 via connections to the national grid and 1,852 with individual solar kits), in the next three years who at present do not have access to electricity.
The project will have a positive environmental impact since it will help to reduce CO2 emissions through the use of renewable energy. It will promote conservation by: using renewable sources of energy (solar energy) and reducing deforestation. Comasel Louga has opted for solar powered systems to complement the electricity provided by Senelec. Clean renewable energy sources will help reduces the use of individual fuel based generators and wood fuels thus reducing pollution in these communities.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Abdessamad Saddouq Office national de lElectricité 65, rue Othman Den Affane 20 000 Casablanca Morocco Email: saddouq@one.ma

name.narrative: The concession area comprises all villages of the departments of Louga, Kebemer and Linguere. The concession area represents 15% of the Senegalese territory and covers a surface of 29,188 km2 with a population of approximately 622,000 inhabitants in 2000 of which 80% is rural. Only 13% of this rural population is currently electrified (as of 2006).

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
